Section 1

Introduction/Hazardous Chemicals



Kemira Chemicals, Inc.(Aberdeen site) is a manufacturer and supplier of high quality chemical flocculants and coagulants used for water and waste water treatment, sludge draining and thickening, and other industrial applications.  



This document includes a brief description of the Risk Management Program at Kemira Aberdeen. The management at Kemira is committed to ensuring chemical safety for its employees and the surrounding community through a comprehensive Risk Management Program that utilizes Process Hazard Analysis, process controls, employee training, emergency response procedures and operating procedures.



1.1    Process Description



The addition of the acrylamide manufacturing process at Kemira Aberdeen triggered the need for a Risk Management Program in accordance with Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act.  Acrylamide is manufactured through hydrolysis of acrylonitrile, which is a regulated substance.  The Kemira process includes an above ground acrylonitrile storage tank with a storage capacity of 50,000 gallons (336,500 pounds).  The 112(r) threshold quantity for acrylonitrile is 20,000 pounds.



The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for the site is 325998, "All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Products and Preparation Manufacturing."

Section 2

Chemical Safety/Emergency Response 



Kemira's overall approach to chemical safety has focused on the following areas:

1    Hazard Identification through Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),

2    Design and implementation of engineering process safety controls,

3    Classroom-style and hands-on training for all employees involved in acrylamide production, and

4    Implementation of operating and emergency response procedures.



The comprehensive Process Hazard Analysis was conducted August 29 2014 using HAZOP methodology.  This approach is a formal systematic critical examination of the process and engineering intentions of new or existing facilities to assess the hazard potential that arise from deviation in design specifications and the consequential effects on the facilities as a whole.  The consequences of the hazard and measures to reduce the frequency with which the hazard will occur are then discussed. This technique had gained wide acceptance in the process industries as an effective tool for plant safety and operability improvements.



Kemira has an Emergency Response Plan and a Spill Response Plan which provide specific guidance for handling plant-wide spills and emergencies.  Both plans were recently updated to address specific hazards associated with the acrylamide manufacturing process.

































    

 

Section 3

Accidental Release Prevention 



Kemira has implemented both procedural and technological safeguards to prevent accidental release of acrylonitrile.  Procedural safeguards are evidenced by Kemira's comprehensive operational procedures and training program.  



Technological safeguards include:

?    Scrubber

?    Relief valves

?    Check valves

?    Auto shutoff

?    Manual shutoff

?    Alarms

?    Backup pump

?    Emergency power

?    Grounding equipment

?    Purge system

?    Process area detectors



Administrative safeguards include:

?    Emergency and

spill response procedures



Mitigation systems include:

?    Area dike (surrounding storage tank)

?    Water cannon



Kemira is subject to and complies with the following regulations associated with the acrylamide manufacturing process:



?    OSHA Process Safety Management (29 CFR 1910.119)

?    EPA Section 112(r) Clean Air Act, Accidental Release Prevention/Risk Management Plan

?    DHS Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards (CFATS)



















    

 

Section 4

Five Year Accident Summary 



The acrylamide process was implemented in year 2012.  There have been no accidental releases of acrylonitrile.

































    

 

Section 5

Planned Changes to Improve Safety



As of the date of this document, there are no planned changes to improve safety.
